Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) caused by the severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a highly contagious disease that may break the healthcare system of several countries. On January 22, the numbers of confirmed COVID-19 cases were 580 but, at the present date (August 5), these numbers increased to 18.3 million worldwide.
1 The transmission can occur among humans via oral and nasal respiratory droplets and contact with contaminated surfaces.
2 For instance, droplets in aerosol from a cough can spread 4 to 5 m and a sneeze can spread droplets up to 8 m away.
